guide.title: Hardened Gentoo
guide.subtitle: Main Page
guide.abstract: Hardened Gentoo is a official project with the goal of bringing advanced security measures to the Gentoo linux distribution

body.p: Hardened Gentoo is an umbrella project which oversees the research, implementation, and maintainence of security oriented projects for Gentoo Linux. We are a team of very competent individuals dedicated to bringing advanced security to Gentoo with a number of subprojects.

Hardened Gentoo's purpose is to make Gentoo viable for high security, high stability production server environments. This project is not a standalone project disjoined from Gentoo proper; it is intended to be a team of Gentoo developers which are focused on delivering solutions to Gentoo that provide strong security and stability. These solutions will be available in Gentoo once they've been tested for security and stability by the hardened team.

The current active subprojects in Hardened Gentoo are:
Project: Description:
SELinux integration Adding SELinux support to Gentoo and portage, this includes providing kernels with SELinux support, providing patches to userland utilities, writing good Gentoo specific default profiles, and programatically deploying policies via portage.
Propolice Propolice is gcc stack smashing protection written by IBM. More details here
Systrace ACL support systrace is a lightweight ACL system with an easy to use policy editor and a gui for on-the-fly policy management. Additionally this allows applications which require root capabilities to run without setuid and setgid flags
Hardened-sources kernel A kernel which provides patches for hardened subprojects, and stability/security oriented patches

The current planned subprojects in Hardened Gentoo are:
Project: Description:
SAL Secure Auditing for Linux. This provides government level secure auditing which can be used to take legal action against attackers. This is a logging system that supports secure, encrypted, protected logs which cannot be modified easily
HIDS Host Intrusion Detection System. There are many possibilities, whichever we choose we'll provide good gentoo specific policies and documentation on tweaking it in your environment. There is also the possibility that portage will have an integrated HIDS at some point in the future
Openwall userland patches Openwall provides patches to daemons which allow them to be chrooted and add privilege seperation
Additional crypt algorithms Added algorithms to the unix crypt() function including blowfish and tcb
Forum for security oriented products To provide a place for security oriented projects, like Kerberos, to be hosted, maintained and documented
Security Documentation There are plans to maintain documentation about best practices, and general security measures such as process limiting, setting quotas, securing systems with kerberos, chrooting, tightening services, et al
CryptoAPI Cryptographic filesystem support, possibly using FiST
Bastille Bastille is an interactive app which gives the user suggestions on securing their machine. It will be customized to make suggestions about other Hardened Gentoo subprojects
Grsecurity Grsecurity acl policies, documentation outlining effective use of grsec

Hardened Gentoo is a collection of subprojects. Each of these subprojects is optional, and you must explictly enable each subproject you wish to use. A list of projects available and how to enable them is available below.

tr.ti: use the selinux-x86-1.4 profile with ln -s /usr/portage/profiles/selinux-x86-1.4 /etc/make.profile. This is not ready for widespread use due to lack of policies.
Propolice will be available in GCC by default soon, to enable it on compilations add -fstack-protector
emerge sys-apps/systrace if sys-apps/gtk-systrace if you have gtk and sys-kernel/hardened sources for systrace support in your kernel

To participate in the Hardened Gentoo project first join the mailing list at gentoo-hardened@gentoo.org. Then ask if there are plans to support something that you are interested in, propose a new subproject that you are interested in or choose one of the planned subprojects to work on. You may talk to the developers and users on irc.freenode.net on #gentoo-hardened for more information or just to chat about the project or any subprojects. If you don't have the ability to actively help by contributing work we will always need testers to maintain the security and stability of the overall product. All development, testing, and productive comments and feedback will be greatly appreciated.
